choices.D: Reboot and enable secure boot from the UEFI firmware interface.
choices.A: Skip unused VIBs during boot up.

discussion.content: UEFI is already on, right answer should be C.
Answer is C. Remove the VIBS. https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/2018/06/prepping-an-esxi-6-7-host-for-secure-boot.html
UEFI and Secure boot are not the same thing. You can enable UEFI without using secure boot. Secure boot is needed when a signed boot loader is used.
Agree - Should be C. Do fix the issue you have to delete the unused VIB

Correct answer is C. :Ephemeral port groups are generally only used for recovery purposes when there is a need to provision ports directly on a host, bypassing vCenter Server.
 https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/1022312#ephemeral

questions.question_text:
An administrator decides to implement vSphere networking using the VDS.
Which binding option should the administrator use to manage the VMs if vCenter becomes unavailable?

choices.C: Assign affinity or anti-affinity rules to the appropriate VMs for each department.
choices.A: Adjust NIOC or SIOC as appropriate to give the QA department a higher compute priority within the cluster.
choices.D: Set the VM priority to high for QA department VMs and normal for Marketing department VMs.
choices.B: Create a resource pool for each department and use the Shares attribute to prioritize the allocation of resource.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has an environment with these conditions and requirements:
✑ The host provides 6GHz of CPU and 32GB of memory
✑ The host is shared between the Marketing and QA departments
✑ The QA department needs a higher compute resource priority
How can the administrator meet the conditions and requirements?

discussion.content:
B is correct Answer.
D is not correct because there is no setting called as Priority.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-0F6C6709-A5DA-4D38-BE08-6CB1002DD13D.html

3 or 30 ?
ESXi can be configured to send log files to a vCenter Server rather than storing them to a local disk. The recommended maximum numbers of supported hosts to collect logs from is 30.

comments.content: 30 is the max to collect FROM and 3 is the max to collect TO

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator configures log forwarding for remote syslog server in a vCenter Server Appliance (VCSA) through the vCenter Server Appliance
Management Interface (VAMI).
What is the maximum number of remote syslog servers that can be configured?

A vSphere administrator needs to migrate VMs in the same vCenter from New York to California due to impending severe weather.
Which migration should the administrator perform without causing VM downtime?
